Callbacks¶

Logits difference callbacks¶

Callbacks which use difference between probabilities distribution over last layers. Useful for classification task.

class src.distillation.callbacks.logits_diff.KLDivCallback(output_key: str = 'kl_div_loss')¶

Wrappers¶

Wrappers is useful when your callback inputs something defferent then hidden states or logits, but you don’t want to modify batch in your runner.

class src.distillation.callbacks.wrappers.LambdaWrp(base_callback: catalyst.core.callback.Callback, lambda_fn: Callable, keys_to_apply: Union[List[str], str] = ['s_hidden_states', 't_hidden_states'])¶

Wraps input for your callback with specified function.

Parameters

  • base_callback (Callback) – Base callback.

  • lambda_fn (Callable) – Function to apply.

  • keys_to_apply (Union[List[str], str], optional) – Keys in batch dict to apply function. Defaults to [“s_hidden_states”, “t_hidden_states”].

Raises

TypeError – When keys_to_apply is not str or list.

Hiddens mapping callbacks¶

class src.distillation.callbacks.hiddens_mapping.HiddensSlctCallback(layers: Union[int, List[int]], hiddens_key: str = 't_hidden_states')¶
class src.distillation.callbacks.hiddens_mapping.LambdaSlctCallback(lambda_fn: Callable, keys_to_apply: Union[List[str], str] = ['s_hidden_states', 't_hidden_states'])¶

Filters output with your lambda function. Inplace analog of LambdaWrp.

Parameters

  • base_callback (Callback) – Base callback.

  • lambda_fn (Callable) – Function to apply.

  • keys_to_apply (Union[List[str], str], optional) – Keys in batch dict to apply function. Defaults to [“s_hidden_states”, “t_hidden_states”].

Raises

TypeError – When keys_to_apply is not str or list.
